intro: Terminthia paniculata, commonly known as the panicled terminthia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in the summer months. The plant is native to certain regions of Asia and is often found in moist, woodland habitats. Its fruit is a dry schizocarp, splitting into two one-seeded parts when mature. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and ecological adaptations.
